reviews.text:
Surprise quizzes, plays, and presentations. Ms. Torres gives a reasonable amount of work but grades really strictly on them. BEWARE of those surprises quizzes after a reading homework!
A bit boring sometimes but in a good way. AND YOU'RE ALLOWED TO EAT IN CLASS

She's a very nice teacher. But, after reading a text you can expect a quiz the next day. The quizzes can ask some specific questions so make sure you pay close attention when reading. She's sometimes picky on essays too. It's an easy B but surprisingly hard A (not too hard).
Ms. Torres is really nice and the class is pretty easy. We didn't learn much about essay writing though.
She is super super nice, but she does give a lot of essays and shakespeare. Not a super easy A, but she gives a lot of opportunities to make up

Overall, easy B, slightly hard A. You have to write a bunch of tedious essays and perform Shakespeare to the class ;-;
Expect a quiz the day after you start a book. She asks about small details, so you can't get away with using Sparknotes. Slow grader, asks the class stuff a lot
Grades essays or any written assignments  really strictly! Tends to give out a lot of acting or performances projects in class.....

sucks, we did not do anything. was lazy for an entire semester because she was pregnant. we basically just sat there and did not learn anything because we read odyssey "summaries" instead of the real book. super easy A thought.
I took her english class. She is a wonderful person and I liked her class a lot. She's a good teacher and her class isn't difficult.
